segment.source: Automate Windows Setup
segment.target: Automate Windows Setup

segment.source: Automate Windows Setup
segment.target: Automate Windows Setup

segment.source: Automate Windows Setup
segment.target: Automate Windows Setup

segment.source: You can prevent some or all of the user interface (UI) pages from Windows® Setup from being displayed during installation.
segment.target: You can prevent some or all of the user interface (UI) pages from Windows® Setup from being displayed during installation.

segment.source: The default behavior of Windows Setup is to display the Setup UI if any of the required settings are incorrect or empty.
segment.target: The default behavior of Windows Setup is to display the Setup UI if any of the required settings are incorrect or empty.

segment.source: Use an answer file while installing Windows
segment.target: Use an answer file while installing Windows

segment.source: You can automate Windows installation by using an answer file:
segment.target: You can automate Windows installation by using an answer file:

segment.source: Use a USB flash drive
segment.target: Use a USB flash drive

segment.source: Use a sample answer file or create your own with Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM).
segment.target: Use a sample answer file or create your own with Windows System Image Manager (Windows SIM).

segment.source: Save the file as Autounattend.xml on the root of a USB flash drive.
segment.target: Save the file as Autounattend.xml on the root of a USB flash drive.

segment.source: On a new PC, put in the Windows product DVD and the USB flash drive, and then boot the PC.
segment.target: On a new PC, put in the Windows product DVD and the USB flash drive, and then boot the PC.

segment.source: When no other answer file is selected, Windows Setup searches for this file.
segment.target: When no other answer file is selected, Windows Setup searches for this file.

segment.source: Select an answer file
segment.target: Select an answer file

segment.source: You can select a specific answer file during installation by booting to the Windows Preinstallation Environment, and using the setup.exe command with the /unattend:filename option.
segment.target: You can select a specific answer file during installation by booting to the Windows Preinstallation Environment, and using the setup.exe command with the /unattend:filename option.

segment.source: For sample answer files and a list of settings used to automate installation, see Settings for Automating Windows Setup.
segment.target: For sample answer files and a list of settings used to automate installation, see Settings for Automating Windows Setup.

segment.source: Sample answer files
segment.target: Sample answer files

segment.source: The following sample files are included in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) in the following folder:
segment.target: The following sample files are included in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (Windows ADK) in the following folder:

segment.source: C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits8.0Assessment and Deployment KitDeployment ToolsSamplesUnattend.
segment.target: C:Program Files (x86)Windows Kits8.0Assessment and Deployment KitDeployment ToolsSamplesUnattend.

segment.source: List of settings
segment.target: List of settings

segment.source: The following is a list of the settings used in these answer files:
segment.target: The following is a list of the settings used in these answer files:

segment.source: Windows Setup language settings: Microsoft-Windows-International-Core-WinPEUILanguage and Microsoft-Windows-International-Core-WinPESetupUILanguageUILanguage.
segment.target: Windows Setup language settings: Microsoft-Windows-International-Core-WinPEUILanguage and Microsoft-Windows-International-Core-WinPESetupUILanguageUILanguage.

segment.source: Product key: Microsoft-Windows-SetupUserDataProductKeyKey.
segment.target: Product key: Microsoft-Windows-SetupUserDataProductKeyKey.

segment.source: Automating Windows Setup
segment.target: Automating Windows Setup

segment.source: To automate Windows Setup, add settings for each of the following Windows Setup pages to your unattended Setup answer file.
segment.target: To automate Windows Setup, add settings for each of the following Windows Setup pages to your unattended Setup answer file.

segment.source: When a setting for a Windows Setup page is configured, Windows Setup skips that page.
segment.target: When a setting for a Windows Setup page is configured, Windows Setup skips that page.

segment.source: Language, Region, and Input Method Selection Page
segment.target: Language, Region, and Input Method Selection Page

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-International-Core-WinPE | UILanguage
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-International-Core-WinPE | UILanguage

segment.source: Specifies the default language to use on the installed Windows operating system.
segment.target: Specifies the default language to use on the installed Windows operating system.

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-International-Core-WinPE | SetupUILanguage | UILanguage
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-International-Core-WinPE | SetupUILanguage | UILanguage

segment.source: Specifies the default language to use during Windows Setup.
segment.target: Specifies the default language to use during Windows Setup.

segment.source: During installation, Windows Setup displays installation progress in the selected language.
segment.target: During installation, Windows Setup displays installation progress in the selected language.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When you use an Autounattend.xml file with Windows Setup and rely on an implicit answer-file search, the language selection page in Setup is not displayed, even if you explicitly do not configure language settings in your answer file.
segment.target: When you use an Autounattend.xml file with Windows Setup and rely on an implicit answer-file search, the language selection page in Setup is not displayed, even if you explicitly do not configure language settings in your answer file.

segment.source: For more information about implicit answer files, see Windows Setup Automation Overview.
segment.target: For more information about implicit answer files, see Windows Setup Automation Overview.

segment.source: Type your Product Key for Activation Page
segment.target: Type your Product Key for Activation Page

segment.source: The product key must match the Windows edition you intend to install.
segment.target: The product key must match the Windows edition you intend to install.

segment.source: For more information, see Work with Product Keys and Activation.
segment.target: For more information, see Work with Product Keys and Activation.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | UserData | ProductKey | Key
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | UserData | ProductKey | Key

segment.source: Specifies the product key used to install Windows.
segment.target: Specifies the product key used to install Windows.

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | ImageInstall | OSImage | InstallFrom | MetaData | (Key and Value).
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | ImageInstall | OSImage | InstallFrom | MetaData | (Key and Value).

segment.source: Use Key and Value together to select a specific Windows image to install.
segment.target: Use Key and Value together to select a specific Windows image to install.

segment.source: Required for some Windows Server® 2012 editions.
segment.target: Required for some Windows Server® 2012 editions.

segment.source: You can get the image information by using the DISM /Get-ImageInfo command.
segment.target: You can get the image information by using the DISM /Get-ImageInfo command.

segment.source: For more information, see Image Management Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see Image Management Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Accept Microsoft Software License Terms Page
segment.target: Accept Microsoft Software License Terms Page

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | UserData | AcceptEula
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | UserData | AcceptEula

segment.source: Specifies whether to accept Microsoft License Software Terms during Windows Setup.
segment.target: Specifies whether to accept Microsoft License Software Terms during Windows Setup.

segment.source: Select Upgrade or Custom Installation Page
segment.target: Select Upgrade or Custom Installation Page

segment.source: By default, when an answer file is used, this page does not appear and Windows is configured as a new installation.
segment.target: By default, when an answer file is used, this page does not appear and Windows is configured as a new installation.

segment.source: To configure Windows as an upgrade, add the following setting:
segment.target: To configure Windows as an upgrade, add the following setting:

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | UpgradeData | Upgrade
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | UpgradeData | Upgrade

segment.source: Specifies that the present installation is an upgrade from a previous version of Windows.
segment.target: Specifies that the present installation is an upgrade from a previous version of Windows.

segment.source: Specify Where to Install Windows Page
segment.target: Specify Where to Install Windows Page

segment.source: You can either specify the exact disk ID and partition ID, or you can install Windows to the first available partition.
segment.target: You can either specify the exact disk ID and partition ID, or you can install Windows to the first available partition.

segment.source: To preconfigure your partitions, you may also need to configure your drive partitions.
segment.target: To preconfigure your partitions, you may also need to configure your drive partitions.

segment.source: For full XML examples and recommended partition configurations, see How to Configure UEFI/GPT-Based Hard Disk Partitions or How to Configure BIOS/MBR-Based Hard Disk Partitions.
segment.target: For full XML examples and recommended partition configurations, see How to Configure UEFI/GPT-Based Hard Disk Partitions or How to Configure BIOS/MBR-Based Hard Disk Partitions.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | ImageInstall | OSImage | InstallTo | DiskID
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | ImageInstall | OSImage | InstallTo | DiskID

segment.source: Specifies the disk where Windows will be installed.
segment.target: Specifies the disk where Windows will be installed.

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | ImageInstall | OSImage | InstallTo | PartitionID
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | ImageInstall | OSImage | InstallTo | PartitionID

segment.source: Specifies the partition where Windows will be installed.
segment.target: Specifies the partition where Windows will be installed.

segment.source: -or-
segment.target: -or-

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | ImageInstall | OSImage | InstallToAvailablePartition
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | ImageInstall | OSImage | InstallToAvailablePartition

segment.source: Specifies to install Windows on the first available partition.
segment.target: Specifies to install Windows on the first available partition.

segment.source: Settings to Use with Unattended Windows Deployment Services
segment.target: Settings to Use with Unattended Windows Deployment Services

segment.source: When deploying Windows using Windows Deployment Services, add each of the settings in the following sections to your unattended-Setup answer file.
segment.target: When deploying Windows using Windows Deployment Services, add each of the settings in the following sections to your unattended-Setup answer file.

segment.source: These are the only settings required for an unattended installation.
segment.target: These are the only settings required for an unattended installation.

segment.source: Select a Language and Locale Page
segment.target: Select a Language and Locale Page

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-International-Core-WinPE | SetupUILanguage | UILanguage
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-International-Core-WinPE | SetupUILanguage | UILanguage

segment.source: Specifies the default language to use during Windows Setup.
segment.target: Specifies the default language to use during Windows Setup.

segment.source: Provide Windows Deployment Services Credentials Page
segment.target: Provide Windows Deployment Services Credentials Page

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | WindowsDeploymentServices | Login
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | WindowsDeploymentServices | Login

segment.source: Specifies the credentials used for Windows Deployment Services logon, and specifies in what circumstances the UI is displayed for logon.
segment.target: Specifies the credentials used for Windows Deployment Services logon, and specifies in what circumstances the UI is displayed for logon.

segment.source: Select an Image to Install Page
segment.target: Select an Image to Install Page

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | WindowsDeploymentServices | ImageSelection
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | WindowsDeploymentServices | ImageSelection

segment.source: Specifies the image to be installed and the location where it is installed, as well as whether the UI is displayed.
segment.target: Specifies the image to be installed and the location where it is installed, as well as whether the UI is displayed.

segment.source: Specify Where to Install Windows Page
segment.target: Specify Where to Install Windows Page

segment.source: These settings assume that you are installing to a partitioned disk drive.
segment.target: These settings assume that you are installing to a partitioned disk drive.

segment.source: Setting
segment.target: Setting

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | WindowsDeploymentServices | ImageSelection | InstallTo | DiskID
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | WindowsDeploymentServices | ImageSelection | InstallTo | DiskID

segment.source: Specifies the disk ID of the disk to which the image is to be installed.
segment.target: Specifies the disk ID of the disk to which the image is to be installed.

segment.source: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | WindowsDeploymentServices | ImageSelection | InstallTo | PartitionID
segment.target: Microsoft-Windows-Setup | WindowsDeploymentServices | ImageSelection | InstallTo | PartitionID

segment.source: Specifies the partition ID of the partition to which the image is to be installed.
segment.target: Specifies the partition ID of the partition to which the image is to be installed.
